snippet: Returning to the farm where Donnie and Joe Emerson recorded “Dreamin’ Wild,” a 1979 album that has become an out-of-the-blue cult hit.
abstract: Visit to the 1970s-style studio where musicians and brothers Don and Joe Emerson wrote and recorded songs as teenagers on their family farm in Fruitland, Washington; their album Dreamin' Wild, released in 1979, has become an unexpected cult hit after being rescued from obscurity by a music blogger.
lead_paragraph: Returning to the farm where Donnie and Joe Emerson recorded “Dreamin’ Wild,” a 1979 album that has become an out-of-the-blue cult hit.

headline.seo: Touring the Farm Where the Emerson Brothers Recorded Their 1979 Album
headline.main: A Time Capsule Set to Song
headline.print_headline: A Time Capsule Set to Song
headline.content_kicker: At Home With Donnie and Joe Emerson
